result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell S Alonso was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall provide DNA sample.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment, schooling, or combination of both.

Defendant shall obtain/maintain stable residence.

Defendant shall cooperate with Thinking for Change programming as directed by probation agent.

Defendant shall pay Department of Corrections supervision fees.

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: CP.  Court reviews Information w/def.  State moves to dismiss and read-in Ct 2; Court so orders. Court orders presentence investigation be prepared.  Counsel req bond modification; State objects.  Court amends bond to $1,000 cash.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.
